properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters of Swain's Island; Coastal waters of Manua; Coastal waters of Tututila and Aunuu
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 16 at 10:17AM SBT by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
Storm force winds of at least 48 kts will impact American Samoa
coastal waters tonight through Tuesday, as a complex environment
within the active monsoon trough keeps the possibility of
a tropical cyclone developing over or near the islands. Also,
seas are expected to reach up to 24 feet or higher Monday and
Monday night, especially near thunderstorms.

A storm warning means sustained winds of 48-63 kts (55-73 mph) or
greater, is either predicted or occurring, and not directly
associated with a tropical cyclone.

Storm force winds and dangerous seas could capsize or damage
vessels and the frequent showers could reduce visibility.

Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid possible hazardous
conditions. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe wind and seas.

Listen to NOAA Weather Radio for the latest updates.

You may also follow us on Facebook "NWSPagoPago" or our website
at www.weather.gov/ppg.

NWSheadline: A Storm Warning is in effect for all coastal waters of American Samoa
